conclusion: Rectangular sides: l₁ = AB = 0.20 m, l₂ = BC = 0.50 m

premise: Rectangular sides: l₁ = AB = 0.20 m, l₂ = BC = 0.50 m
conclusion: Coil area A = l₁ × l₂ = (0.20 m)(0.50 m) = 0.10 m²

premise: Coil turns: n = 100, Magnetic-flux density: B = 0.10 T, Coil area A = 0.10 m², Angular speed: ω = 100 π rad s⁻¹
conclusion: Time-dependent magnetic flux through the coil Φ(t) = n B A cos (ωt)

The cosine appears because flux is maximum when the plane of the coil is perpendicular to the field and zero when it lies in the neutral position; at t = 0 the cosine is zero, matching the statement in the problem.

premise: Time-dependent magnetic flux through the coil Φ(t) = n B A cos (ωt)
conclusion: Induced emf ε(t) = − dΦ/dt = − n B A (−ω) sin (ωt) = n B A ω sin (ωt)

conclusion: Peak (maximum) emf ε_max = n B A ω = (100)(0.10 T)(0.10 m²)(100 π rad s⁻¹) = 1.0 × 100 π V = 100 π V ≈ 3.14 × 10² V
